alert.note: Alert for Eastern Glacier, Western Toole, and Central Pondera (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued December 06 at 3:20PM MST until December 07 at 11:00AM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST WEDNESDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM TO 5 PM MST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...For the first Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Additional snow accumulations up to one inch. For the Wind Chill Advisory, wind chills as low as 30 below zero expected. For the second Winter Weather Advisory, blowing and drifting snow expected. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph at times. * WHERE...Eastern Glacier, Western Toole, and Central Pondera. * WHEN...For the first Winter Weather Advisory, until 5 PM MST this afternoon. For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 11 AM MST Wednesday. For the second Winter Weather Advisory, from 6 AM to 5 PM MST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The dangerously cold wind chills tonight and Wednesday morning could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. Blowing and drifting snow on Wednesday may significantly reduce visibility and cause partial lane blockages. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The Winter Weather Advisory in effect for today has been cancelled.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Glacier, Western Toole, and Central Pondera
